title: News: Michael Kiwanuka winner of the BBC Sound of 2012
body:
**The winner of the BBC sound of 2012 poll of music critics, broadcasters & bloggers has been announced as British soul musician Michael Kiwanuka.**

Compared to Bill Withers, Van Morrison and the Temptations, Kiwanuka’s brand of retro soul, RnB & folk was inspired from a most unlikely discovery. A rare recording of Otis Redding’s [Sitting On The Dock of the Bay](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UCmUhYSr-e4 "Otis Redding - Sitting On The Dock of the Bay [YOUTUBE]") stuck to the front of a magazine tribute to Bob Dylan.

“I love that sound,” Kiwanuka told the [BBC](http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-16266507 "Michael Kiwanuka BBC Interview - 6th Jan") earlier today “The singers I listen to are quite old-school and I think that era is really cool. The way the chords sounded, and the feeling of the playing is very loose. There’s a jazz feel compared to a lot of modern music, which is very straight.”

The 24 year old North Londoner came out tops in the [BBC Sound of 2012](http://www.bbc.co.uk/music/soundof/2012/ "BBC Sound of 2012 award") poll ahead of Singer-songwriter Frank Ocean, Rapper Azealia Banks, producer DJ Skrillex and Swedish electro-duo Niki and The Dove.

Michael Kiwanuka will be playing a number of intimate gigs across the UK & Ireland over the next few months.His new EP ‘Home Again’ is officially released on [Polydor Records](http://www.polydor.co.uk/ "Polydor Records") on the 26th March 2012 following his debut ‘I’m Getting Ready’ released last year on [Interscope](http://www.interscope.com/ "I'm Getting Ready Michael Kiwanuka"). For tour dates and to check out his new single visit Michael’s official site: [http://michaelkiwanuka.com/](http://michaelkiwanuka.com/)
